Name: Indianara Pereira de Souza
Description:
Indianara died after being run over by a truck driven by a client with whom she had had a disagreement.

> A trans woman died after having her head crushed on kilometer 435 of BR-364, in Várzea Grande, heading towards the municipality of Jangada, after being thrown from the cabin of a truck, this Friday (2). The victim, identified by the name Indianara, was wearing only underwear. The name on the record is Rogério Pereira de Souza.
> 
> Preliminary information indicates that the woman had a sexual encounter with a truck driver and spent the night taking drugs. However, this Friday she was thrown out of the truck and was subsequently run over and killed on the highway. This information was passed on by Indianara's colleagues. 
> 
> According to Nova Rota do Oeste, the company's rescue team arrived at the scene and found the victim already dead. The vehicle that was apparently involved in the accident was not at the scene when the team arrived.
> 
> The Federal Highway Police (PRF), Civil Police and Official Expertise and Technical Identification (Politec) were called to carry out the appropriate procedures. The Civil Police are conducting investigations to obtain access to the security cameras to clarify the crime and locate the driver who ran over the victim.

Name: Gul Ghatay
Description:
Gul was shot and critically injured. She was taken to hospital, where she succumbed to her injuries 9 days later.

It was later revealed that she was shot because she refused her killer's advances.

>PESHAWAR: Rejecting a suspect's advances ended up costing a member of the transgender community her life after she breathed her last on Tuesday. Gul Ghatay, who was shot and critically injured on August 4 for not "maintaining a friendship", spent the last few days struggling for her life at the Lady Reading Hospital.
>
>The 31-year-old Gul Ghatay, hailing from the Mardan district of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, was shot near the Hashangri Police Station at around 1:30 AM on the night of August 4 as she was returning home from a musical evening. She was critically injured and was transferred to the Lady Reading Hospital in Peshawar, where she succumbed to her injuries some nine days later.
>
The transgender community in Peshawar is deeply saddened by Gul Ghatay's murder. Arzu, the President of the Khyber Pakhtunkhwa [trans woman] Association, told the Express Tribune that transgender individuals were regularly being murdered, and their bodies were dumped with impunity. She bemoaned that the murderers rarely faced justice.
>
>Arzu reported that seven transgender individuals have had killed in Khyber-Pakhtunkhwa in 2024, and the community was outraged over Gul Ghatay's death. Over the past few years, approximately 137 transgender individuals have been murdered in Khyber-Pakhtunkhwa, with only one perpetrator having been convicted, she said.
>
>Regarding the shooting of Gul Ghatay, ASP Hushangri Mohammad Ali informed the Express Tribune that an FIR has been filed, and two suspects were taken into custody. He added that as some others were on the run, but would be brought to book at the soonest. He assured that justice will be served to the transgender community.

Name: Chantelle Ifeanyi ("Abuja Area Mama")
Description:
Chantelle's body was found in the street.

> LGBTQ+ activists in Nigeria are raising concerns about their safety after a popular cross-dresser was killed Thursday in the capital. Police have launched a probe into the killing, which activists say is one of many cases recorded in recent weeks.
> 
> Franklin Ejiogu is trying to come to terms with the tragedy that struck early Thursday -- his friend, a Nigerian cross-dresser known as the "Abuja Area Mama," was killed by unknown attackers.
> 
> Area Mama's body was found by the roadside. Ejiogu says it's not clear how the events unfolded, but the cross-dresser had a gunshot wound to [her] head.
> 
> He blames a recent surge in fatal attacks on LGBTQ+ people on the signing of the so-called Samoa Agreement by Nigerian authorities.
> 
> "What actually pushed up these hate crimes is the signing of this Samoa Agreement. Media houses in Nigeria broke news that Nigerian government was encouraging LGBTQ+ movement in Nigeria and now the nonstate actors are now targeting the transgender community members and nonbinary people,” he said. “On Sunday, one transperson was lynched in Kogi state and on Monday, another transperson was also lynched."
> 
> Ejiogu is the founder of Nigeria’s Creme De la Creme, a trans and nonbinary peoples' support organization. He says they've been issuing security warnings to community members on an online forum, and that’s where he hears about attacks.
> 
> Nigeria's national law punishes same-sex relationships by up to 14 years in jail. And in the more conservative Muslim north, it could lead to a death sentence under sharia law.
> 
> In 2022, Nigerian authorities tried to enact a law to criminalize crossdressing, but the law was suspended following protests.
> 
> Months ago, Area Mama appeared in a viral video, saying he’d been targeted by a mob and injured with a machete.
> 
> Empress Cookie called for justice, saying, “This person that was murdered was human, and they need to give justice to this person. It's because Area Mama is a well-known person, that's why her own came to timeline and bloggers are posting it... but on a daily basis we're being killed."


Chantelle was a sex worker who documented her life on social media. Her Instagram profile is https://www.instagram.com/area_mama_of_abuja/.

Name: Clemmy Hadebe
Description:
Clemmy was shot in the street while she was walking home.

> A friend of [Clemmy] Hadebe, a transgender woman recently murdered in Johannesburg, has spoken out to correct what they describe as inaccurate media reports about the circumstances of her death.
> 
> The friend, identified as Sasha, spoke to MambaOnline about the tragic night [Clemmy] was shot multiple times. Sasha confirmed that [Clemmy] was 22-years-old, identified as a trans woman, and had recently started transitioning. Sasha refuted media reports that [Clemmy] was killed by a man she met while out partying, who then took her to a bed and breakfast and shot her in anger upon discovering she was transgender.
> 
> Sasha shared that she had grown close to [Clemmy] in the past few months after [Clemmy] had moved from her hometown of Newcastle in KwaZulu-Natal. She lived with her boyfriend in Malvern, Johannesburg and worked from home as an online forex trader.
> 
> On Friday, 9 August, [Clemmy], Sasha, and a third friend went clubbing, but the evening took a dark turn when an incident with a taxi driver left the third friend with a broken wrist requiring medical attention. After spending several hours at the hospital with their injured friend, [Clemmy] and Sasha returned to Malvern in the early hours of the morning and decided to wind down at the Broadway Pub on Jules Street.
> 
> The two met up with friends and socialised, relieved to have returned safely after the taxi driver incident. Sasha denies reports that men were buying [Clemmy] drinks, saying, “We sat for a very long time. We just chilled; we didn’t even dance like we normally do when we go out.”
> 
> At around 4:45 am, [Clemmy] told Sasha she was heading home and left on foot. A few minutes later, Sasha received a frantic call from friends outside the pub. “They said, ‘They shot your friend!’ We ran as a group of friends towards the scene, about three streets away, maybe 800 metres. When I got there, Clemmy was on the ground, bleeding from the stomach, her eyes open,” Sasha recalled, adding that [Clemmy] was unresponsive.
> 
> “I was confused; I was traumatised. I tried to check if she was breathing, but I didn’t know what to do. I was just with Clemmy, and now she’d been shot…”
> 
> Police and an ambulance arrived, as did [Clemmy]’s boyfriend, who had been at home sleeping. The young woman was pronounced dead at the scene, and the gravity of the situation became painfully real.
> 
> Sasha and several friends are planning a march and candelight vigil to honour [Clemmy] and call for justice for their lost friend.
> 
> “Clemmy was a sweetheart, a bubbly person. She wanted to be a model; everyone said she was a beauty. But her dreams have been lost, just washed down the drain. Life can be taken away from you just like that—that’s what happened to Clemmy,” Sasha mourned.
> 
> Police have confirmed to MambaOnline that a murder investigation is underway. The motive is unknown and no arrests have been made.

Name: Danna Rodríguez ("La Güera del Sur")
Description:
Danna died after being shot by hitmen in what appears to have been a targeted assassination. She was an LGBT+ community leader known for her work supporting social causes.

> San Nicolás Galeana, Morelos .- Danna Rodríguez, known as 'La Güera del Sur' and leader of the LGBT+ community in the south of the State of Morelos, was shot dead this Friday, in the municipality of Zacatepec. According to information from authorities, the armed attack occurred around 9:43 pm (local time) while the trans woman was in a crafts store in the Vicente Guerrero neighborhood of the city of  San Nicolás Galeana.
> 
> Witnesses reported that two men arrived on a motorcycle, one of them pulled out a gun and shot Danna, who was known in the region for her altruistic work in social causes and her help to neighbors, several times. The victim suffered a gunshot wound to the head and fell down some stairs. When paramedics arrived at the scene they gave her first aid, however, they confirmed that she no longer had vital signs.
> 
> Neighbors and relatives covered her body while the municipal police cordoned off the area, awaiting the arrival of the forensic services from southern Morelos, who removed the body and transferred it to the Forensic Medical Service of the municipality of Jojutla for the corresponding investigation. It should be mentioned that the murder of Danna Rodríguez occured 14 days after the Historic March for Sexual Diversity in Morelos.
> 
> Since last night, the LGBT community of Zacatepec and the State shared their outrage through social media, condemning the crime and demanding that the authorities do justice. In addition, many people and members of the LGBT + community dedicated messages of love to her, remembering her good works. Collectives in Morelos have been promoting modifications to the Penal Code to classify "hate crimes."

Name: Maria Eduarda Souza Lima
Description:
Maria died after being stabbed in the back by Douglas Mikael Teles de Souza Gabilani after an argument. He was arrested and another man is being sought by police.

> Maria Eduarda, 34, was murdered with a stab in the back in the early hours of this Friday (23), in Jardim das Meninas, in Campo Grande. The suspect was identified as Douglas Mikael Teles de Souza Gabilani, 30 years old. The disagreement was motivated by the betting game, known as "Tigrinho".
> 
> There were two young men in the property where the crime took place when Douglas arrived at around 00:50. The police report does not detail the relationship between those involved, but they all knew each other.
> 
> Douglas arrived and attacked Eduarda, and they began to fight, when the suspect grabbed a knife and stabbed the victim in the back. He then fled. SAMU (Mobile Emergency Care Service) was called, but there was no chance of saving Eduarda and she was declared dead.
> 
> The young people who witnessed the crime reported that the fight started because of the Tigrinho game, but there are no details. The case was registered at the police station and Douglas Mikael is wanted by the police.
> 
> Eduarda was a trans woman, but had not yet [legally] changed her name. Her death certificate states that she was [deadname] Souza Lima.

Douglas Mikael Teles de Souza Gabilani, 30, was arrested for Maria's murder on 14th September 2024.

Name: Ana
Description:
Ana's body was found inside a candy and cake stand during the early hours of Friday 30th August.

> A lifeless person was found around 5 a.m. this Friday, August 30, inside a candy and cake stand, located above a bus stop on Avenida Ejército Mexicano in Boca del Río, Veracruz.
> 
> After several hours, a coworker recognized the lifeless person who was identified as Ana, 40 years old, a transgender woman member of the LGBT+ community, originally from Tuxpan, Veracruz.
> 
> Initial reports indicated that Ana had allegedly been killed in an assault; however, her body showed no signs of violence, so this cause was ruled out. Her death is presumed to be related to health issues; however, authorities continue to investigate the cause of her death.
> 
> The events prompted an immediate mobilization of emergency and security forces. State Police officers arrived at the scene to cordon off the area , as did Naval Police officers , who carried out the corresponding procedures after the body was found .
> 
> Likewise, Red Cross paramedics arrived at the area and confirmed that the transsexual woman no longer had vital signs, so she was transferred to the Forensic Medical Service (SEMEFO) for her respective autopsy and thus be able to determine the cause of her death .
> 
> Despite the police presence and the cordoning off of the area, vehicular traffic on the Mexican Army Avenue continued slowly but without major impacts following the discovery of the lifeless trans woman identified as Ana .

Source: Centro de Apoyo a las Identidades Trans
